articles.title: China locks down city of 13 million in bid to curb COVID outbreaks before Beijing Winter Olympics
articles.description: The restrictions in Xi'an come just weeks before the Winter Olympics and are some of the harshest China has imposed since it locked down Wuhan after the coronavirus was first detected there in 2019.
articles.content: Beijing — China is redoubling efforts to control new virus outbreaks with a lockdown of the 13 million residents of the northern city of Xi'an following a spike in coronavirus cases. The measure come… [+2824 chars]

articles.title: China puts city of 13 million in lockdown ahead of Olympics
articles.description: BEIJING (AP) — China plunged a city of 13 million people into lockdown on Thursday to stamp out an increase in coronavirus infections, as the country doubles down on its “zero tolerance” policy just weeks before it is set to host the Winter Olympics.
